name: Fried Asparagus With Caesar Dressing
recipeIngredient: 1 small clove garlic, grated or finely minced
1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more to taste
Lemon juice to taste, plus lemon wedges for serving
16 fat asparagus stalks, trimmed and cut in half lengthwise
4 scallions, trimmed and cut in half lengthwise

recipeInstructions.text:
Combine the egg yolks, garlic, vinegar,
pepper, anchovies, fish sauce (if using) and Tabasco in a bowl. Gradually whisk
in the olive oil, a little at a time, until
the mixture emulsifies and thickens. Add
lemon juice to taste and water to thin
to a creamy consistency.

Meanwhile, heat about 1/2 inch of oil
to 350 degrees in a skillet. Beat together
the eggs and cream, and add a little
salt and pepper. Dredge the asparagus
and the scallions in flour, then egg,
then bread crumbs, and fry, in batches
if necessary, turning once, until nicely
browned, about 5 minutes.

Drain on paper towels, and arrange
on plates; drizzle with the dressing,
top with the Parmesan, and serve with
lemon wedges.
